Meshhandler¶

This module contains currently only a simulation, for how knitpieces adapt to surfaces.

Simulation abstract¶

The surface has a rectangular shape, with 4 distinct borderlines; up, left, down and right. These borderlines correspond to the knitpiece borders. Those borders can be obtained via createcloth.strickgraph.strickgraph.get_borders().

clothfactory parts¶

The function createcloth.meshhandler.relax_gridgraph() is implemented via relax_strickgraph_on_surface. That factoryleaf produces from a corresponding map, saved via map_for_strickgraph and a knitpiece, saved via strickgraph_container spatialdata about the knit piece and saves it under strickgraph_spatialdata.

References¶

createcloth.meshhandler.relax_gridgraph(gridgraph: createcloth.strickgraph.strickgraph_base.strickgraph, surfacemap: createcloth.meshhandler.PlySurfaceHandler.dataclass.plysurfacehandler) → Dict[Hashable, Dict]¶

Relax gridgraph on surface

Parameters

surfacemap (plysurfacehandler.surfacemap_utils.surfacemap) – asdf

Returns

Dictionary of every stitch with its locations as dictionary. Form of returned dict is ‘{ ‘x’: xpos, ‘y’:ypos, ‘z’:zpos }’

Return type

Dict[ Hashable, Dict ]
